modules.description: Provides functions to represent and reference specific character encodings, including ASCII and UTF-8. Works with type-safe encoding identifiers, distinguishing between ASCII and UTF-8 through polymorphic variants. Used to ensure correct encoding handling in text processing and data serialization tasks.

Combines and manipulates regex compilation and search options using a monoid structure. Operates on typed options for compile-time and search-time settings, such as case insensitivity, multiline matching, and group capturing. Used to construct precise regex behaviors by merging flags like `ignorecase` with `multiline` or `find_longest`.

Provides regular expression syntax configurations for various standards and tools, including POSIX basic and extended, Emacs, grep, Java, Perl, and more. Works with the `t` type to represent different regex syntax flavors. Used to specify syntax rules in pattern matching libraries for consistent behavior across implementations.

Returns the number of captured groups in a match result and provides byte offsets for the start and end positions of specific captures. Operates on a custom type representing matched regions from pattern matching operations. Used to extract precise locations of submatches in a string for post-processing or analysis.

Provides regular expression matching, substitution, and extraction using Oniguruma's syntax and features. Works with strings, buffers, and captures groups as tuples or lists. Enables precise pattern matching in text processing tasks such as parsing log files or validating input formats.

Encodes and processes text using type-safe ASCII and UTF-8 representations, enabling precise handling of character data. Combines regex options through monoid operations to define complex matching behaviors, such as case-insensitive multiline searches. Supports multiple regex syntax standards, allowing consistent pattern matching across different tools and environments. Extracts detailed match information, including group counts and byte offsets, to enable fine-grained analysis of matched text.
